author: Ren√© Voorburg

resources.description:
If called without any parameter, the API returns all markers in Geo-JSON format. This call can be demanding on the server so try not to do this call more than once. If you want to build your own services on the Vici.org data, please use the following call:

  http://vici.org/points.php?bounds=38.0,-7.0,40.0,-5.0&zoom=11

This call only return the markers for the area defined by two corners of 'bounds' (latitude, longitude of south-west point, latitude, longitude of north-east point). The higher the value of 'zoom', the more 'detail' markers are returned.
resources.name: Search API

resources.description:
http://vici.org/object.php?id=45
Returns the data for a specific marker with supplied 'id' in Geo-JSON format. Currently not all available data is returned. This is work in progress.

http://vici.org/object.php?id=45&lang=nl
Returns the object specified by `id=45` with annotations in Dutch, regardless http content negotation.
resources.name: Object API

organization.description:
Open Archaeology. See the [Working Group on Open Data in Archaeology](http://wiki.okfn.org/wg/archaeology) for more details.

Please note that only open data should be added to this group. Data to enquiry may be tagged "archaeology".

### Metadata

See <http://wiki.osgeo.org/wiki/Location_in_CKAN> for the proposed metadata for both spatial and temporal dimensions. Basically, use meaningful tags.
organization.title: Open Archaeology
organization.name: archaeology

name: vici-org
notes:
Vici.org is a geographic resource for the Roman world, collecting and publishing point-data about settlements and relevant places.

If you alter, transform, or build upon this work, you may distribute the resulting work only under the same or similar license to this one.
title: Vici.org
